column4: I just installed ubuntu in a dualboot scenario and windows still automatically boots.  What can I do about this>
What did you use for your bootloader?
well I dont know if it installed GRUB or not. I'm guessing not since windows still auto boots.  How can I install grub without having to install ubuntu again?
I did what that link said and it didnt work.
Are you sure you installed it to the same hard drive that BIOS boots from?
no im not sure. How do I check this?
You'd have to boot into BIOS and look around, it's usually under like "Standard CMOS features" or something similar
Make sure the boot order tells it to boot to the drive with grub first
And you installed grub to the MBR?
I think so.  Thats what that link you gave me said that would do and I followed the guide to the T.
Do you have any other installations of linux on any partitions except the one you just installed?
Then honestly I'm not sure why it's booting to the windows bootloader
dang.  I've been having this issue for like 2 days now.
no one has been able to help me fix it.
